Amazing game. 10/10
Een leuk spel vooral in de conversaties van de robots :)
Geile packende einzigartige Story, super Gameplay, unvergleichliches Setting, viele Zusätzliche Missionen durch User-Level.

Si te gusto Portal 1 y quieres saber mas sobre Aperture no te tienes que perder esta secuela, como siempre tiene una dificultad que va aumentando pero nada es imposible. Aparte el modo co-op es muy bueno para pasarlo con un amigo.

Portal 2 is a cleverly fun and interesting game. Taking place in the run down facility known as Aperture Labratories, the protaginist is lead through the crumbling ruins of what used to be a scientific research facility. Portal 2 is a non stop puzzler, filled with great characters, and a story line that never stops being good. If you have the money I would say buy this title as soon as possible. If you dislike puzzle games however, stay very far away.  

I had a LOT of fun playing this game. As you work through the puzzles, you get these hilarious scripted scenes. Like when GLaDOS throughs confetti at you through one of the tubes used to transport cubes. Ahh man, so many laughs, worth EVERY penny.
good

One of the best games in my library. Perfect balance of action puzzel and comedy

Portal 2 es un juego único y que debe ser jugado por todos aquellos que amen el género y los videojuegos en general. Portal te ofrece entretenida variedad de puzzles, a los cuales puedes añadir aquellos que los propios jugadores han creado a través de la workshop. Es un juego al que jamás le echarás suficientes horas, así que no esperes más y compralo!

Если первый Portal был пробным шаром, выбившим страйк, то Portal 2 разнесла вдребезги весь кегельбан. Великолепное продолжение гениальной игры. И хотя непосредственно история Челл на этом, похоже, заканчивается, хочется надеяться, что в серии Portal компания Valve сможет и дальше реализовывать оригинальные дизайнерские идеи.

Only a few hours into the single player so far but Portal 2 is quick to bring back all the parts I enjoyed from Portal 1. The highlight being the sense of humor from the AI throughout the game.

The setting is also intriguing as you wander through the testing levels wondering what happened.

Looking forward to playing the rest and maybe work on some of the achievements.

2比1好玩 嗯嗯

There are very few games that I have played that have captivated my interest fully 100%. From Battlefield's multiplayer, to Assassins's Creed's TV like story lines, and Bioshocks's narratives, they have all made me slowly stand up from my computer seat and proceed to clap after playing them (Maybe not Battlefield, but rush mode gets my blood pumping). Portal 2 is one of them. The general concept of the game is so original and innovative compared to other triple-A FPS titles. Rather than gun down your enemy, why not portal them somewhere else and let gravity do the work. The game does not require you to run and gun, rather to let you think out  and how to approach each level. The narrative, characters, and voice acting too, are absolutely amazing. Wheatly in my opinion is one the best side-characters of any video game in history (Well actually, the companion cube might easily sit right next to him). He'll say a funny line from room to room and you'll never get bored of this moron. GLaDOS will always be GLaDOS, sarcastic, condescending, and cold even to the end. Overall the single player gets a 10/10.

Co-op too does not fail to amaze. Two minds and two portal guns are always better than one, unless this friend of your likes to rip your robotic head off every single test chamber. Grab a friend and play a couple test chambers, you'll see why everyone loves this mode so much. It not only can test both your minds, but also communication skills and  maybe even patience. Unlike other co-op games where dropping a med-kit is as far as cooperation goes, you have to actually communicate and talk to your buddy. You need to think each puzzle through and discuss each other's plan of action. And so if you don't even feel like doing any of the test chambers, you can just play rock, paper, scissors, say 'hi' to the camera, rip each others head's off, and  more. In laymen's terms: CO-OP 10/10

[b]TL;DR[/b] : 10/10 get the game now.
Awesome game, 100% worth buying.
It's an amazing game! Play it now!

This is perhaps the best Father/Son game I've ever played with my son. I tell myself that it helps develop his problem solving ability... But really we just enjoy laughing at ourselves try to solve the problems. Game has well balanced level difficulty, a killer storyline and a lot of replay value.
One of the best puzzle games I have ever played. Keeps you engaged and interested all the time.
Great game. Definitely worth the money. Pity there aren't more coop levels. Think portals!

An amazing puzzel platformer no doubt, but I feel like some of GLaDOS's charm was lost in the sequal. She seems a lot more human than computer, which was part of what made her funny and intimidating in the first game. 10/10 awsome game
Portal 2 is a great game. It has been my favorite game since the first time I played it.

The humor in this game is great, and while the main storyline isn't replayable due to it being puzzle based, you can play plenty more community puzzles or even make your own! I definitely reccomend this game for anyone into puzzle games and who enjoys being amused. Portal 2 expands on the mechanics of Portal 1 in a wonderfully organic way.

Brilliant game! Loved the humour, the single-player campaign was just the right length before getting tedious, challenges were always fresh and not always straightforward. Worth the purchase just for the co-op campaign, loads of fun.

However, it IS a bit too short. Cleared single player and co-op campaign (which should have been a bit longer imho) in under 10 h.

8.5/10

I have to say the sequel to Portal exceeded my expectations. Not only did they incorporate exciting new game mechanics into the game, but Valve has given it a co-op option, which many Portal fans had been curious about before the sequel came out. In addition, the ability to be able to create your own Portal maps and publish it to the Steam community for other people to play really opens up the possibilities for this game and guarantees that it is never boring and will always be a new experience.

Now hopefully, Valve is somewhere in the middle of the development of the third installment to the series. :)

Update: No new Portal game but omg there's a new Half Life game....

Enfim, super recomendo o jogo e dou nota 10/10 pra ele, pode comprar. =3
